required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Relationship Between Pre-pregnancy BMI and Weight Gain and Outcomes in Women With Twin Pregnancy
clinical_study.official_title: The Relationship Between Pre-pregnancy Body Mass Index (BMI) and Pregnancy Weight Gain and Pregnancy Outcomes in Women With Twin Pregnancy

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Prepregnancy body mass index (BMI) and gestational weight gain (GWG) have Significant effects on the risk of pregnancy outcomes such as gestational hypertension disease and gestational diabetes mellitus in singleton pregnancies. This paper is to investigate the relationship between pre-pregnancy body mass index (BMI) and weight gain during pregnancy and pregnancy outcomes in women with twin pregnancy.

primary_outcome.measure: the incidence of gestational diabetes mellitus, gestational hypertension and small for gestational age

clinical_study.condition: Twin Pregnancy; Body Mass Index; Weight Gain; Pregnancy Outcome

arm_group.arm_group_label: normal weight woman with twin pregnancy
overweight and obese woman with twin pregnancy

intervention.description: a standardized and structured questionnaire that included information on age, residence, education, pregnancy history, disease history, height, and conception method, after obtaining the consent of all participants.
intervention.arm_group_label: normal weight woman with twin pregnancy
overweight and obese woman with twin pregnancy

study_pop.textblock: The participants include women with twin pregnancy meeting the inclusion criteria

overall_official.affiliation: Second Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University

facility.name: department of obstetrics of Second Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University
